page.title: 11B.B.C. Training
page.content: A mass search was held at the time of the Munich crisis by 3 men of the corporation to find a new property. Wood Norton Hall was seen and by the spring of 1939 the British Broadcasting Corporation became the new owners of this hall. The Engineer in charge of Wood Norton started his duties in the Easter of 1939.In the grounds the workshop provided:Two post office teleprinter channels which had been installed for transmitting monitored material to London,and post office lines had been installed by two alternative routes for communication with the main broadcasting network and with the telephone exchange. During the war drama,music and school programmes were trasmitted.
